SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Card
Abstract representation of in-game cards Holds methods and parameters that helps handle and generate every card in the game.
CardLocation
Record that allows to describe the location on the player's board of a placed card.
CardSlot
Record that represent a Card along with its orientation and placement turn number (if the card was placed) It also "remap" certain Card methods in order to take advantage of the information in the record.
Chat
The Chat class allows users to communicate with each other through an in-game text chat.
ChatController
ChatController class manages the chat component in the GUI.
ChatMessage
ChatMessage represents a message sent from a player to another (or broadcast)
ChatTUIScene
ChatTUIScene handles the interface that allows the CLI user to read chat messages and send messages.
Client
Allows to run the client application that allows to play the game as a client.
ClientChatMsgMessage
Message that the client can send to the server in order to send a chat message.
ClientGameData
ClientGameData class allows to create objects that contain all the information that is needed to recreate a game representation object on the client's View.
ClientHandler
Generic client handler object.
ClientMessage
Abstract message that the Client sends to the Server.
ClientPlayerData
ClientPlayerData class allows to create objects that contain all the information that is needed to recreate a player object on the client's View.
ClientToServerPingMessage
Allows the client to send a ping message to the server.
Command
Command allows to define a method that takes a TextualUserInterface and an array of tokens as parameters.
CommandParser
CommandParser is a Runnable object that allows to asynchronously process user input through the console and to execute the commands.
CommonGoalsUpdateMessage
Message that the Server sends to a Client to provide the public goals
ConnectionConfirmationMessage
Message that the Server sends to a Client to confirm that it was correctly connected to the server.
Corner
Enum that represents the possible configuration for a card's corner.
CoveredCornersScoringStrategy
A scoring strategy that awards points based on the number of corners covered by the card upon placement.
CreateGameController
CreateGameController allows the GUI client player to create a game providing the number of player and the nickname of the creating player.
CreateGameTUIScene
CreateGameTUIScene handles the interface that allows the TUI user to create a new game.
Deck<T>
An abstract representation of the concept of deck of a specified type of element.
DeckLoader<T>
The DeckLoader class allows to create objects to load decks' content from files.
DeckUpdateMessage
Message that the Server sends to a Client to inform it that one of the deck has changed.
Drawable
Interface that object that can be put in decks needs to implement.
DrawCardMessage
Message that the Client sends to require to draw from a deck or pick up one of the visible cards
DrawTUIScene
DrawTUIScene handles the interface that allows the TUI user to pick up one of the drawable cards.
FreeScoreScoringStrategy
A scoring strategy that awards a fixed score to the player upon placing a card.
Game
The Game class represents a game session of the Codex Naturalis game
GameBackup
GameBackup allows to store all the information needed to reload a game and to make it looks like the game was never actually closed and reloaded.
GameBackupManager
GameBackupManager, if enabled, allows to save and reload games from the disk.
GameController
GameController allows players to play a game.
GameControllerWrapper
Remote Object that allows RMI clients to send message directly calling method on this object.
GameData
GameData allows to store and share information regarding a game (with no information regarding the game phase)
GameListMessage
Message that the server sends to a client to provide the available games list
GameListRequestMessage
Message that the client can send to the server in order to request the list of available games
GameResultsTUIScene
GameResultsTUIScene handles the interface that allows the TUI user to view the game scoreboard/results
GameStatus
Enum that represents the possible states for a Game
GameStatusUpdateMessage
Message that the server sends to the clients to update the current game status (turn status and current turn)
GameViewController
GameViewController handles the interface that allows the GUI player to play the game.
Goal
The Goal class provides an abstract representation of an object that describes a goal.
GoalDeckLoader
The GoalDeckLoader class allows to create objects to load standard game's goals from files.
GraphicalUserInterface
GraphicalUserInterface allows to present the game's information and to catch the player's input through a javafx-based GUI application
GUIClientLauncher
Allows to launch a GUI client application to play the game through a graphical user interface
GUIScene
Abstract representation for a GUI interface scene.
ItemCollection
ItemCollection is class that allows to store information about amounts of items.
ItemCountScoringStrategy
A scoring strategy that awards score based on the number of a specific item present in the player's inventory.
ItemGoal
Represents a goal based on collecting specific items.
JoinConfirmationMessage
JoinConfirmationMessage allows the server to confirm that a client joined a certain game.
JoinGameController
JoinGameController allows GUI interface users to join an existing game.
JoinGameMessage
Message that the client sends when it's trying to connect to an existing game or to create a new one.
JoinGameTUIScene
JoinGameTUIScene handles the interface that allows the TUI user to join one of the available games
LeaveGameMessage
LeaveGameMessage allows players to leave games without the need for the need for the client di disconnect from the server.
LobbyTUIScene
LobbyTUIScene handles the interface that allows the TUI user to select its color and view the list of connected players
MainController
Allows to manage multiple games.
MainControllerWrapper
Remote object that allows players with RMI client to join and create game.
MainSceneController
MainSceneController represent the standard interface that the GUI interface user will see (upon connecting) when launching the game.
MainScreenTUIScene
MainScreenTUIScene handles the interface that the TUI user is presented to upon connecting to the server
MediaManager
MediaManager class allows to load images from the resources.
Message
Generic message that allows the server and clients to share data
MessageType
Enum that represents the possible types of message that can be sent/received.
Observable
Abstract representation of an object that can be observer by various observers.
Observer
Generic representation for an object that can subscribe to Observable objects.
PatternGoal
Represents a goal based on matching a specific pattern of resources on the player's board.
PlaceCardMessage
Message that the Client sends to require to place a cards on its board
PlaceStartCardMessage
Message that the Client sends to require to place the starting card on its board.
PlaceStartCardTUIScene
PlaceStartCardTUIScene handles the interface that allows the TUI user to place the starting card.
PlayCard
Represents both Gold and Resource cards.
PlayCardDeckLoader
The PlayCardDeckLoader class allows to create objects to load standard game's PlayCards from files.
Player
Player object are used to handle a player's object within a game.
PlayerBoardTUIScene
PlayerBoardTUIScene handles the interface that allows the user to view a player's board and to place cards.
PlayerColor
Enum representing the possible colors for players.
PlayerData
PlayerDAta allows to store and share information regarding a Player, including secret data.
PlayersBoardUpdateMessage
Message that the Server sends to a Client to inform it that one of the boards has changed.
PlayersHandUpdateMessage
Message that the Server sends to a Client to inform it that one of the players received a new card.
PlayersListUpdateMessage
Message that the server sends to the clients when a players join, leave or change color (lobby only).
Printer
Printer is a helper class that the TextualUserInterface allows to print the game elements like cards, goals, boards.
Printer.Canvas
Canvas allows to handles dynamic matrices of characters.
Printer.TextColor
Helper enum that helps to map the wanted text color to the code that needs to be added to the string in order to display the color.
PrivateGoalController
PrivateGoalController handles the GUI scene that allows the GUI user to select the private goals once the game starts.
PrivateGoalUpdateMessage
Message that the Server sends to a Client to inform it that its private goals were updated.
ProtocolController
ProtocolController handles the interface that the GUI user uses to connect to the server.
ProtocolTUIScene
ProtocolTUIScene handles the interface that allows the TUI user to connect to the server by providing IP, port and protocol
Resource
Subset of the Corner enum representing only the Resource types that can be used as Card types.
RMIClientHandler
Implementation of the ClientHandler interface that allows to handle clients that communicates with the server through RMI (Remote Method Invocation).
RMIConnectionPseudoMessage
"Message" that the server uses internally in order to process RMI connection request asynchronously.
RMIServer
Contains static method (RMIServer.setup) that allows to set up the RMI components that allows RMI clients to connect and play.
RMIServerHandler
Handle the client-side RMI (Remote Method Invocation) connection to the server
RulesController
RulesController handles the interface that allows to read the game rules.
ScoreBoard
The ScoreBoard class represents a scoreboard that tracks players' score throughout the game.
ScoreBoardController
ScoreBoardController allows to check the current scores displayed on the physical game scoreboard.
ScoreUpdateMessage
Message that the server sends to the clients when the scoreboard is updated
ScoringStrategy
The ScoringStrategy functional interface allows providing a function that evaluates a card placement.
SelectColorMessage
Message that the client sends to the server in order to request to change the player's color
SelectGoalMessage
Message that the Client sends to require to select one of the available private goals
SelectGoalTUIScene
SelectGoalTUIScene handles the interface that allows the TUI user to select the private goal.
Server
Contains main method to run Server components for socket and RMI clients to connect and join
ServerChatMsgMessage
Message that the server sends to the client in order to forward a chat message.
ServerErrorMessage
Message that the server sends to a client when an error occurs while processing one of the client's messages in order to report such error.
ServerHandler
Abstract object that Handle the client side connection to the server.
ServerMessage
Abstract message that the Server sends to the Client.
ServerToClientPingMessage
Allows the server to send a ping message to a client.
SocketClientHandler
Implementation of the ClientHandler interface that allows to handle clients that communicate with the server through TCP sockets.
SocketServer
Thread object that needs to be run in order to allow connection from socket clients.
SocketServerHandler
Handle the client-side socket connection to the server.
StartCard
Represents Starting cards.
StartCardDeckLoader
The GoalDeckLoader class allows to create objects to load standard game's StartCards from files.
StartCardUpdateMessage
Message that the Server sends to a Client to provide the Starting card.
StartingCardController
StartingCardController handles the GUI scene that allows the GUI user to place the starting card once the game starts.
TextualUserInterface
TextualUserInterface allows to present the game's data to the User (and catch the user's input) through the console.
TUIClientLauncher
Allows to launch a TUI client application to play the game through a textual user interface
TUIScene
Abstract representation of an interface that can be used to present information to the TUI user.
TurnStatus
Enum that represents the possible status for a player's turn in the game.
UserInterface
Interface that allows to define User Interfaces to present the game data to the player and to process the player's input.
View
 
ViewWrapper
Client-side remote object that receive Remote Method Invocations from the Server and "transform" them into messages that will be processed by the actual View (View) asynchronously.
VirtualController
VirtualController allows to define an abstract GameController's interface that can be used by clients in order to perform RMI calls on methods that requires the GameController's execution
VirtualDeck
VirtualDeck allows the client's view to hold an object that looks like an actual Deck, but doesn't actually contain any data regarding the cards inside the matching server's deck.
VirtualDeckLoader
Allows the client to force the local Game object to create VirtualDeck object.
VirtualMainController
VirtualMainController allows to define an abstract VirtualMainController's interface that can be used by clients in order to perform RMI calls on methods that requires the VirtualMainController's execution
VirtualView
Remote Interface that allows to define standard methods to update a player's view.
VisibleCardUpdateMessage
Message that the Server sends to a Client to inform it that one of the visible cards has changed.
WaitingForPlayersController
WaitingForPlayersController handles the interface that the GUI user is presented with upon joining/creating a game.
